newsitem.title: ITALY: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL STARTS AFTER DELAY.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL STARTS AFTER DELAY.

text.p: A men's Alpine skiing World Cup downhill got underway on Friday after being delayed for one hour because of bad weather.
The race, which had been scheduled for 1300 local (1200 GMT), began at 1400 (1300) with the start brought down the mountain from 2,249 metres to 2,170.
Organisers first delayed the race start by half an hour and then decided to delay for a further half hour as heavy cloud shrouded Val Gardena and snow continued to fall.
Friday's race had already been rescheduled once, after the Canadian resort of Whistler Mountain was unable to stage it earlier this month due to heavy snow.
